abstract.para: Describes how to create a push messaging-enabled app with &AMHlong;.

section.title: Adding an Android App With &AMHlong;
section.para: &AMHlong; provides quickstart code that includes all of the functionality necessary for an Android app to receive push notifications from Amazon Pinpoint. This topic shows how to generate the quickstart app code using the &AMHlong; console.

If you want to integrate Amazon Pinpoint push notifications with your own Android app, we recommend that you generate the &AMHlong; quickstart app code by following the procedure in this topic, so that you can download and examine the code for guidance.

step.para: Sign in to the AWS Management Console and open the &AMHlong; console at &url-console-domain;mobilehub/.
If you have other &AMHlong; projects, choose Create new mobile project. If this is your first project, skip this step because you will be taken directly to the page for creating a new project.
Provide a project name. The name you enter will be the name of your app in the &PIN; console.
For the region, keep US East (Virginia).
Choose Create project. &AMHlong; creates the project and shows the Pick and configure features for your project page.
On the User Engagement page, choose Enable engagement.
For What platforms do you want to send push notification messages to, choose Android.
Enter the following credentials, which are available from your push messaging-enabled project in Firebase or Google Cloud Platform:

listitem.para: For API Key, enter your server key.
For Sender ID, enter your sender ID. In Google Cloud Platform, the sender ID is called project number.

step.para: Choose Save changes. &AMHlong; opens the Integrate page for your app.

listitem.para: You can download a working sample app that demonstrates &PIN; features. Then, you can add the sample app to &PIN; and send a test push notification.
You can download a package that includes the required SDKs for your project. Then, you can follow the instructions in the &AMHlong; console to integrate &PIN; with your app.
